questions.question_text: After rebooting an AP, a user is no longer able to connect to the enterprise LAN. A technician plugs a laptop in to the same network jack and receives the IP 169.254.0.200. Which of the following is MOST likely causing the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
If you see a 169.254. x.x address, it means that the DHCP server is not reachable. The PC will not work because there is not a router to or from that PC. Troubleshoot this by finding out why the PC cannot see the DHCP server.

Selected Answer: A
APIPA only occurs at 169.... when dhcp is not working, so dhcp scope is exhausted

Which ethernet jack? Of the AP? God, there could be vlan trunking configured and you are plugging in a PC to the same jack which connects the AP? And what if there is passive-POE? 
But yeah, from the options it looks like DHCP exhaustion. Because other options does not make sense. But the main red-herring is that the AP is restarted. Before restarting it was fine. Yeah, it could be DHCP exhaustion because the device will do a DHCP Discovery again after associating again to the AP.

questions.question_text: A technician is deploying a new switch model and would like to add it to the existing network monitoring software. The technician wants to know what metrics can be gathered from a given switch. Which of the following should the technician utilize for the switch?

discussion.content:
MIB (Management Information Base) A data set that defines the criteria
that can be retrieved and set on a device using SNMP.
I would say MIB for sure

The MIB (Management Information Base) is an essential component of network managing systems. It is a virtual database used for managing the devices in a communications network. By using an MIB, a network administrator can determine what information a device can provide for monitoring purposes (like traffic statistics, status information, etc.), as such this would be the appropriate choice to identify what metrics can be gathered from a new switch.

To gather metrics from a network switch and integrate it into network monitoring software, the technician should primarily utilize SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol) and MIB (Management Information Base). So, the correct option here would be:

A

Selected Answer: A
MIB with no doubt

Selected Answer: A
a) MIB ( managment information base)

Selected Answer: A
I would say MIB (management Infromation Base)

comments.content: Solution is not to re-use passwords and not about using complex passwords. Does a password policy cover not re-using passwords. Probably does. I will also choose this.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Rainbow tables are tables of reversed hashes used to crack password hashes. Computer systems requiring passwords typically store the passwords as a hash value of the user's password. When a computer user enters a password, the system hashes the password and compares it to the stored hash.

questions.question_text: A network administrator is concerned about a rainbow table being used to help access network resources. Which of the following must be addressed to reduce the likelihood of a rainbow table being effective?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Key points about scalability in cloud computing:
Minimal effort:
Expanding or contracting a cloud environment with minimal effort is a key characteristic of scalability

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

questions.question_text: Which of the following describes the ability of a corporate IT department to expand its cloud-hosted VM environment with minimal effort?

comments.content:
Internet speed test probably isn't a good idea anyways because that only tells you the speed between you and a server that you choose from a list, which you don't know the specifications of. So you won't know if the low speed is coming from an issue on your end or if the server just has a slower connection.
I'm still learning so the above is just my understanding.
Assuming he is trying to get the files internally. Because iperf needs a server and a client. Otherwise internet speed test is the option. I will choose iPerf because looks like that's what they want

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. iPerf.

iPerf is a tool used to measure network performance by generating traffic between two endpoints. It provides detailed information about network throughput, packet loss, and latency. In this case, an engineer can use iPerf to measure the performance of the network between the remote office and the central location to identify the cause of the slow file transfers. Packet capture can be used to analyze the network traffic, but it may not provide the detailed measurement data required to diagnose the issue. SIEM log review is not relevant for this scenario, and an internet speed test only measures the performance of the user's internet connection and not the network between the remote office and the central location.

questions.question_text: A user from a remote office is reporting slow file transfers. Which of the following tools will an engineer MOST likely use to get detailed measurement data?
